channel.title: bitbucket Tutorial on
channel.description: Recent content in bitbucket Tutorial on

item.title: Getting started with bitbucket
item.description: Getting started with Bitbucket - Create an account # Create an account Go to https://bitbucket.org/ Click on Get Started on the top right corner Enter your email address, and click continue Enter your full name, password and verification code. Then click Continue An email will be sent to you to verify that you created your account After that you have now an account on Bitbucket and you can login to it

item.title: Add collaborators to a repository
item.description: How to add users and groups to an existing Bitbucket repository # Go to the Bitbucket repository you want to add users to. On the left, go to Settings (the last icon on the bottom left). Select Users and group access. Under Users, start typing the name or email address of the user whom you want to add. Select the privilege you want to grant that user (Read, Write or Admin).

item.title: Create Issue in Bitbucket
item.description: Enable issue tracker in Bitbucket # Go to the repository you want to create issue for, something like: https://bitbucket.org//<repo_name>/ Go to setting, left bottom corner Select Issue tracker under Issues Select the type of the issue tracker you want to enable (no issue tracking, private or public) Click save Now the issue tracker is enabled for your repository

item.title: Add comments to commits in Bitbucket
item.description: Adding comment to a commit in Bitbucket # Go to the repository, e.g.: https://bitbucket.org/username/repo_name/ On the left menu, choose commits Select the commit you want to add comments to On the selected files related to that commit, click on the small + sign appearing near the line numbers A small window will appear to enter the text Click comment

item.title: Create a new repository
item.description: Create a new repository on Bitbucket website # Go to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview Login to your Bitbucket account Choose repositories from the top menu, then choose Create Repository Choose the owner, enter the repository name and select if you want to have it public or private repository Choose the repository type (Git or Mercurial) Open the advanced settings, and enter the information that you find appropriate for your project Then select create repository Now you have a blank repository created for you

item.title: Import repository into Bitbucket
item.description: Import existing repository to Bitbucket # Go to the repository you want to clone (something like: https://bitbucket.org/username/repo) On the top menu, choose Repository -> Import repository In the Old repository section, enter the source (CodePlex, Git, Google Code, Mercurial, Source Code, Subversion) and the URL In the New repository section, enter the Owner, the repository name, the access level (note: each one of the sources in step 3 has different inputs that needs to be added, in our example, we are focusing only on Git)

item.title: Branching in Bitbucket
item.description: Creating a branch in Bitbucket # Go to the repository, e.g.: https://bitbucket.org/username/repo_name/ On the left menu, choose branches On the right side of the branches page, select Create branch A popup window will appear, select Branch from and enter the new branch you want to create in the Branch name textbox Click create A new branch will be created Delete a branch in Bitbucket # Go to the repository, e.g.:https://bitbucket.org/username/repo_name/ On the left menu, choose branches Select the branch you want to delete from the branches page Click on … at the top right of the page, then click Delete branch A confirmation popup will appear, click Confirm

item.title: Clone existing repository
item.description: Cloning a Git repository # Go to the repository you want to clone (something like: https://bitbucket.org/username/repo) On the left side, click on … and choose Clone A small window will appear, copy the url (something like: git clone https://hamzawey@bitbucket.org/hamzawey/vm_dop_experiment.git) Open a terminal window on the machine you want to clone that project to Navigate from the command line to the location you want to clone the project and enter the command copied in step 3
